intro: Lesquerella gordonii var. densifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces a unique seed oil that contains erucic acid, making it valuable in industrial applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its ecological and economic significance, it is also of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
